Living things are greatly influenced by the environment. The reason biodiversity is destroyed is because of the food chain. In the ecological pyramid, even if only one of the producers' primary, secondary, and tertiary entities disappears due to environmental factors (e.g., global warming or river pollution), many animals are in a food web relationship, so when one individual disappears, others disappear, and biodiversity has been decreasing recently.

As more animals become extinct due to changes in the environment, the biodiversity of an ecosystem decreases. Decreasing biodiversity reduces the diversity of the food chain, which in turn results in the extinction of more living things.
